publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7691 Sandra White: Aspect Prize Winner—That the Parliament congratulates the Glasgow artist, Adam Kennedy, on winning the Aspect Prize, one of the United Kingdom’s largest independently funded arts prizes, established by Charles Jamieson and organised in conjunction with the Paisley Art Institute in an annual exhibition at the Paisley Art Gallery and Museum, with the four finalists showcasing their work at the Aspect Prize Winners’ London Exhibition held at The Fleming Collection; considers that the Aspect Prize and the The Fleming Collection, the largest private collection of Scottish art, have done great work in promoting and encouraging Scottish art and artists, and wishes Adam and the three other finalists continuing success in the future. Supported by: Jamie McGrigor*, Maureen Watt*, Jim Tolson*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-7691 Aspect Prize Winner (lodged on 11 January 2011) Anne McLaughlin*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jamie Hepburn*, Gil Paterson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Hugh Henry*

S3M-7691 Sandra White: Aspect Prize Winner—That the Parliament congratulates the Glasgow artist, Adam Kennedy, on winning the Aspect Prize, one of the United Kingdom’s largest independently funded arts prizes, established by Charles Jamieson and organised in conjunction with the Paisley Art Institute in an annual exhibition at the Paisley Art Gallery and Museum, with the four finalists showcasing their work at the Aspect Prize Winners’ London Exhibition held at The Fleming Collection; considers that the Aspect Prize and the The Fleming Collection, the largest private collection of Scottish art, have done great work in promoting and encouraging Scottish art and artists, and wishes Adam and the three other finalists continuing success in the future. Supported by: Jamie McGrigor, Maureen Watt, Jim Tolson, Bill Kidd, Anne McLaughlin, Kenneth Gibson, Jamie Hepburn, Gil Paterson, Joe FitzPatrick, Hugh Henry
S3M-7691 Aspect Prize Winner (lodged on 11 January 2011) Liam McArthur*
S3M-7691 Aspect Prize Winner (lodged on 11 January 2011) Linda Fabiani*
S3M-7691 Aspect Prize Winner (lodged on 11 January 2011) Stuart McMillan*

S3M-7691 Sandra White: Aspect Prize Winner—That the Parliament congratulates the Glasgow artist, Adam Kennedy, on winning the Aspect Prize, one of the United Kingdom’s largest independently funded arts prizes, established by Charles Jamieson and organised in conjunction with the Paisley Art Institute in an annual exhibition at the Paisley Art Gallery and Museum, with the four finalists showcasing their work at the Aspect Prize Winners’ London Exhibition held at The Fleming Collection; considers that the Aspect Prize and the The Fleming Collection, the largest private collection of Scottish art, have done great work in promoting and encouraging Scottish art and artists, and wishes Adam and the three other finalists continuing success in the future. Supported by: Jamie McGrigor, Maureen Watt, Jim Tolson, Bill Kidd, Anne McLaughlin, Kenneth Gibson, Jamie Hepburn, Gil Paterson, Joe FitzPatrick, Hugh Henry, Liam McArthur, Linda Fabiani, Stuart McMillan
